availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1862-1863

body.p:
STATE WARRANT. -- JAMES BARNET, Printer, 189 Lake Street, Chicago.
STATE OF ILLINOIS,
COOK COUNTY, } SS.
The People of the State of Illinois to all Sheriffs, Coronors and Constables within said State, GREETING:

Whereas complaint, under oath, has been this day entered before the undersigned, a Justice of the Peace, within and for said County, by Cyrus P. Bradley that a forgery has been committed in ^the County of Henry in^ said State, and that said complainant has just and reasonable grounds to suspect that Edwin S. Piper alias E. B. Ballard is guilty of said forgery You are therefore hereby commanded forthwith to arrest the said Edwin S. Piper alias E. B. Ballard and bring him before me, (or, in my absence, before some other Justice of the Peace, in said County,) to answer to the people of the State of Illinois, on said charge, and abide such further order as may be concerning him upon said charge and hereof make due service and return as the law directs.
Given under my hand and seal at my office in S Chicago in said Cook ^County^ this 27th day of December A.D. 1862

T B Brown
SEAL
Justice of the Peace.

The People
vs
Edwin S. Piper
alias E B Ballard
Warrant
Cost $1.55
